Ālaka-manda，[ālaya°?] at Vin.II，152 is of uncertain reading and meaning （“open to view”? or “not having pegs” = āḷaka?） vv. ll. āḷakamanta & ālakamandāra； Bdhgh on p. 321 expl<sup>ns.</sup> āḷakamandā ti ekaṅgaṇā manussâbhikiṇṇā，i. e. full of a crowd of people，Ch. quotes ālakamandā as “the city of Kuvera” （cp. Sk. alakā）. （Page 109）
